shooper_assistant_answer: You're looking for the 2023 Ngeringa Pinot Noir, huh?  Well, you've got great taste!  This wine is a real gem, made with biodynamic, minimal intervention methods. It's got a bright and energetic character that's true to its Adelaide Hills origin.  But hey, why stop there?  You should also check out the 2023 Ngeringa 'Small Batch' Sangiovese.  It's a bit darker and plusher, with a round and plump ripeness.  Think of it as the bolder sibling to the Pinot Noir.  Both of these wines are made with the same care and attention to detail, so you can't go wrong with either one!  [https://bahama.gold/products/2023-ngeringa-pinot-noir](https://bahama.gold/products/2023-ngeringa-pinot-noir)  [https://bahama.gold/products/2023-ngeringa-small-batch](https://bahama.gold/products/2023-ngeringa-small-batch)

metadata.body_html:
Biodynamic, Minimal Intervention
Variety: Pinot Noir
Region: Adelaide Hills, SA

A long and cool summer has gifted the Hills with great flavour development and acid retention across all varietals. This has concentration, but the bright and energetic type. Extremely well moulded Pinot that is very true to place.

metadata.body_html:
Biodynamic, Minimal Intervention
Variety: Sangiovese
Region: Adelaide Hills, SA

The grapes are grown on a steep westerly facing slope that sees belting summer sun and often is exposed to characteristic winds of the Adelaide Hills which do much to preserve fruit acids and flavours. This is darker fruited and plush Sangiovese with round and plump ripeness. It has great concentration and length.

metadata.body_html:
Minimal Intervention, Organic, Rose

Variety: Pinot Noir

Region: Nelson, NZ

 

A fascinating rose from Yuki Nakano. Pinot noir free run juice (from the weight of grapes on top of each other) run over some Viognier skins. It's a gorgeously bright, with rose hip & vermouth aromas. Whilst the palate has Orange wine energy with a light chew. It reminds us of Foradori Grigio, iut's just that goddamn good. One for just the two of you to share,

metadata.body_html:
Minimal intervention, Skin Contact, Organic
Varietal: Pinot Gris
Origin: Pyrenees, VIC

Owen Latta is a man continually on the rise. Not only are his family wines, Eastern Peake, hitting strides but his Latta label is entering the Pantheon of the modern greats. The wines continually bring so much joy, subtly hiding how serious they kind of are. Thats a good thing. Iconic already, doing more for the greater Central Vic region than many.

Ex Nihilio goes under different portions of skin contact to release more complexity in the phenolic profile of Pinot Gris which already boasts something other-worldly. It is a mash of elevage which only adds more nuance.

metadata.body_html:
Organic, Minimal Intervention
Varietal: Grenache
Origin: ﻿Pyrennes, Victoria

The Ainsworth's are producing some of the finest wines in Australia. These are packed with personality and flavour. These are a special reminder why Australia is on the global wine map. A true force to be reckoned with.

metadata.body_html:
Minimal Intervention, Organic, Skin-Contact
Varietal: Riesling
Origin: Gippsland, VIC

35yr old vines from plots that have been organically farmed since birth, long and cool ferments, neutral handling. Pure is an understatement. These wines are unforgettable and a true testament to the landscape of modern wine in Australia.
